title: Carterton Walks - Near and Around

images.title: andrew auger / Car park on the edge of Carterton
images.caption: Car park on the edge of Carterton. Used mainly by dog walkers going into Willow Meadows through the wooden gate on the right.

images.title: gary radford / Runway Lights, R.A.F. Brize Norton.
images.caption: Runway Lights, R.A.F. Brize Norton. The Station is home to the RAF's Strategic and Tactical Air Transport (AT) and Air-to-Air Refuelling (AAR) forces, as well as host to many lodger and reserve units.

images.title: Gary Radford, CC BY-SA 2.0 <https://creativecommons.org/licenses/by-sa/2.0>, via Wikimedia Commons
images.caption: Alvescot Church.

images.title: andrew auger / The "Taj Mahal" Carterton
images.caption: The "Taj Mahal" Carterton. As I have heard it called by some. In reality it is the tower giving the Tower Centre its name, I am not aware of it serving any purpose other than decorative.

description: This modern Oxfordshire based town is located in the western part of the county near Witney. This walk from the town takes you through the Willow Meadows to the neighbouring village of Alvescot. The meadows lie on the western side of the town and have some nice footpaths heading south along the Shill Brook. You'll also pass RAF Brize Norton, the largest station of the Royal Air Force. To continue your walking around Carterton head south to visit the nearby village of Bampton. Here you can pick up the Thames Path and enjoy a waterside walk along the River Thames.

details.subtitle: Further Information and Other Local Ideas
details.content: To the west there's Eastleach where you can enjoy two noteworthy Norman churches and an ancient stone slab clapper footbridge over the River Leach. It's another picture postcard place known for its numerous historic buildings and a colourful display of daffodils in the spring. Lovely Southrop can also be visited in this area.

display_address: B4477, Alvescot, West Oxfordshire, Oxfordshire, England, OX18 1PF, United Kingdom
